EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments 
and Control) Regulations to specify new weekly rates of Covid-19 Pandemic 
Unemployment Payment. 

A new weekly rate of Covid-19 Pandemic Unemployment Payment has been 
specified for each of three distinct periods commencing 3 September 2021, 
during which most of those who continue to qualify for Covid-19 Pandemic 
Unemployment Payment will receive a reduced rate of payment. 

From 3 September, those whose average reckonable weekly income is less than 
€200.00 will continue to receive €203.00. 

However, for those whose average reckonable weekly income was equal to or 
greater than €200.00 but less than €300.00, the rate of Covid-19 Pandemic 
Unemployment Payment of €250.00 will decrease by €47.00 per week from 3 
September. Their payment will be reduced to €203.00 per week. 

Those whose average reckonable weekly income was equal to or greater than 
€300.00 but less than €400.00 and those whose average reckonable weekly 
income was equal to or greater than €400.00 will see a reduction of €50.00 per 
week in the amount of Covid-19 Pandemic Unemployment Payment from 3 
September 2021. For 
the weekly rate of Covid-19 Pandemic 
Unemployment Payment will be €250.00 and €300.00, respectively. 

these, 

From 5 November 2021, for those whose average reckonable weekly income 
was equal to or greater than €300.00, the rate of Covid-19 Pandemic 
Unemployment Payment will decrease by €47.00 per week to €203.00 per 
week, while those whose average reckonable weekly income was greater than 
€400.00 will see a reduction of €50.00 per week to €250.00. 

Finally, from 28 January 2022 those whose average reckonable weekly income 
was greater than €400.00 the rate of Covid-19 Pandemic Unemployment 
Payment will decrease by €47.00 per week to €203.00 per week. 

The Regulations also provide 
that payment of Covid-19 Pandemic 
Unemployment Payment will cease for people pursuing a full-time course of 
study on 3 September 2021.
